name: LoomInventory
description: The `LoomInventory` class provides functionality for interacting with loom screens in Minecraft. Looms are used to add patterns to banners using various dye patterns and banner pattern items. This class extends the base `Inventory` class and adds loom-specific functionality while inheriting all standard inventory operations.
overview:
This class is automatically created when you open a loom screen and can be accessed through `Player.getInventory()` or `Inventory.create()` when a loom is open.

The loom interface consists of:
- **Banner Slot** - The banner to be modified (Slot 0)
- **Dye Slot** - The dye color to use (Slot 1)
- **Pattern Slot** - Banner pattern items that unlock special patterns (Slot 2)
- **Output Slot** - The resulting banner with applied pattern (Slot 3)
- **Pattern Selection** - Scrollable list of available patterns

**Notes and Limitations:**
- LoomInventory instances are only valid while the loom screen is open
- Pattern availability depends on the banner, dye, and pattern item combination
- Some patterns require specific banner pattern items to be available
- Pattern IDs follow the Minecraft resource location format (e.g., 'minecraft:stripe_bottom')
- Always check if `inventory` and `inventory.getType().includes("Loom")` return valid values before operations
- Pattern selection may fail if the current combination doesn't support the selected pattern
- The method `selectPatternName()` is deprecated and throws an exception - use `selectPatternId()` instead

constructors.description: Creates a new `LoomInventory` instance for the specified loom screen. This constructor is primarily used internally by JSMacros. Scripts typically obtain instances through `Player.getInventory()` or `Inventory.create()`.

methods.name: listAvailablePatterns
methods.description: Lists all available banner pattern IDs for the current banner and dye combination.

methods.name: selectPatternId
methods.description: Selects a banner pattern by its ID. Returns true if the pattern was successfully selected, false otherwise.

parameters.name: patternId
parameters.description: The ID of the pattern to select (e.g., 'minecraft:stripe_middle').

methods.name: selectPatternName
methods.description: Deprecated. Selects a banner pattern by its localized name. Use `selectPatternId()` instead. This method throws an exception.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The localized name of the pattern.

methods.name: getType
methods.description: Returns the type of the current open inventory screen.

methods.name: getContainerTitle
methods.description: Returns the title of the current open inventory container.

methods.name: getSlot
methods.description: Retrieves the item stack in the specified slot index.

methods.name: getTotalSlots
methods.description: Returns the total number of slots in the current inventory container.

methods.name: getLocation
methods.description: Returns the type or location of the given slot (e.g., 'container', 'hotbar', 'player_inventory').

methods.name: contains
methods.description: Checks if the inventory contains an item by its ID.

methods.name: contains
methods.description: Checks if the inventory contains an item matching the provided `ItemStackHelper` instance.

parameters.name: itemStack
parameters.description: An ItemStackHelper instance to compare with.

methods.name: click
methods.description: Performs a standard mouse click on the specified slot. Takes items if slot has, places if hand has, or moves from inventory to inventory.

parameters.name: slotIndex
parameters.description: The index of the slot to click.

examples:
const inventory = Player.getInventory();

inventory.click(0); // Click banner slot
inventory.click(1); // Click dye slot
inventory.click(2); // Click pattern item slot
inventory.click(3); // Click output slot

methods.name: quick
methods.description: Performs a quick move (shift-click) action on the specified slot, moving items between inventories.

parameters.name: slotIndex
parameters.description: The index of the slot to quick move.
